batchDistributeFromVault(address,address.details: Governance function for efficient batch distributions

params.amounts: Array of amounts corresponding to each recipient

createPoolOneClick(address,uint256,uint2.details: Creates STATE/token pool and burns LP tokens making it UNRUGGABLE

params.stateAmount: Amount of STATE for initial liquidity
params.tokenAmount: Amount of token for initial liquidity

deployTokenOneClick(string,string).details: User only needs to provide name and symbol, function handles the rest

distributeFromVault(address,address,uint.details: This is the proper UI-based governance function that handles distribution internally

params.amount: The amount of tokens to distribute
params.recipient: The address to receive the tokens

returns.auctionsEnded: Whether all auctions have been completed
returns.completedSlots: Number of auction slots completed so far
returns.totalSlots: Total number of auction slots that can be completed (scheduleSize  20)

params.token: Address of the token to query

returns.completedAuctions: Number of auctions completed for this token (cycle number)
returns.isActive: Whether the token is currently in an active auction
returns.isScheduled: Whether the token is scheduled in the auction rotation
returns.maxAuctions: Maximum number of auctions allowed per token (20)
returns.remainingAuctions: Number of auctions remaining for this token

initializeCompleteSystem(address,address.details: This is the MAIN function governance calls via UI to configure everything

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setVaultAllowance(address,address,uint25.details: Resets allowance to 0 before setting the new amount to comply with non-standard ERC20s

setupTokenAllowancesForAirdrop(address[].details: Call this after deploying new tokens to enable Step 1 (airdrop)

params.tokens: Array of token addresses to approve for airdrop

startAuctionWithAutoTokens().details: Automatically calculates next Pakistan 11:30 PM as start timeUses tokens that were automatically registered during createPoolOneClick callsThis is the ONLY function needed to start auctions - just click "Start Auction"

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

addLiquidityToPool(address,uint256,uint2.notice: Add liquidity to existing pool from vault (governance-only)

batchDistributeFromVault(address,address.notice: Batch distribute tokens from SWAP vault to multiple recipients

createPoolOneClick(address,uint256,uint2.notice: One-click pool creation with PERMANENT liquidity (LP tokens burned)

deployTokenOneClick(string,string).notice: One-click token deployment - only requires name and symbol

distributeFromVault(address,address,uint.notice: Governance function to directly distribute tokens from SWAP vault to recipients

getTokenAuctionStats(address).notice: Get auction statistics for a specific token

initializeCompleteSystem(address,address.notice: One-click governance setup for complete system initialization

registerUserForAuctions(address).notice: Public function to register user for auctions (called by AirdropDistributor)

setVaultAllowance(address,address,uint25.notice: Approve a spender to pull tokens from the SWAP vault (required by BuyAndBurnController)

setVaultAllowances(address[],address,uin.notice: Batch-approve a single spender for multiple tokens from the SWAP vault

setupTokenAllowancesForAirdrop(address[].notice: Setup token allowances for airdrop distributor - governance UI function

startAuctionWithAutoTokens().notice: Start auction using auto-registered tokens from pool creation
